intro: Eleocharis afflata var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. It has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
